item.title: Residents from Alexandra Gate throwing rubbish/bin bags in bush area behind their buildings, 14th October
item.description:
Some residents are regularly throwing bin bags and rubbish over their balcony into the bush area behind the building. Management agency of develeopment refusing to take ownership as the “land” is not theirs but the residents belong to them. This has been noticed for a very a year. The bush area is behind Alexandra Gate buildings (Blenheim, Braeburn)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mary Neuner Road, Hornsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike laying on pavement, 14th October

item.title: Constant and disgusting fly tipping, 14th October
item.description:
This is an ongoing situation. I walk through every day with my 4 year old daughter and we face all kinds of rubbish, from broken bottles to chicken bones, household items, cardboard and god knows what else.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Arcola Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drains causing pedestrian to be soaked by vehicles when it rains, 14th October
item.description:
Blocked drains in this area for well over 5 years only seen these cleared once in that time period. When it rains a puddle forms which means pedestrians had to run to not get soaked. It’s not a few seconds run it’s a good 20 second run the whole length of MOJOs (Christ Kings) from the entrance to edge of their boundary. The drains are silted to the top. The drains need a jet wash then a cctv once unblocked. The infrastructure is clearly not suitable and needs remodelling to work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frognal Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Swedish Whitebeam Root Issue, 14th October
item.description:
This mature tree, opposite 44 Oakleigh Crescent, Whetstone, N20, has protruding roots which are a danger to the public; both young and old. Therefore, I would recommend an urgent inspection to determine repair works to the public footpath, and remedial work to the tree roots.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Barfield Avenue, Brunswick Park, London
